Maven TestFlight Plugin

This plugin allows you to push a mobile application to TestFlight.

If you are a JetBrains TeamCity user and want to incorporate a TestFlight extension into your TeamCity projects then check out the ci-teamcity-testflight-plugin.

Goals Overview

There is only one goal in this plugin, upload, however this is not a 'stand alone' plugin. It is designed to run after the project artifact is created and the plugin's executions should be configured to run with either the package or install phase.

  • The upload goal in this plugin gives you the ability to push a specified file to a TestFlight account.

Usage

Please refer to the Example to see how it should be used.

Depending on your objectives this plugin can be used to push an artifact with every build. Optionally you can create a profile that is invoked only when you choose to push an artifact.

Many TestFlight users have an 'internal' and an 'external' account where the internal account is accessed primarily by in house testers and the external account might be owened by your client to which you would send a deliverable.

If you feel like the plugin is missing a feature or has a defect, you can fill a feature request or bug report in our issue tracker. When creating a new issue, please provide a comprehensive description of your concern. Especially for fixing bugs it is crucial that the developers can reproduce your problem. For this reason, entire debug logs, POMs or most preferably little demo projects attached to the issue are very much appreciated.
